TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed WorkflowTheme extends System.Object implements class System.IDisposable

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Workflow.* types are deprecated. Instead, please use the new types from System.Activities.*")

Docs.summary: Provides the look and feel property settings to a workflow in design-time environment.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[DeprecatedContent](~/add/includes/deprecatedcontent-md.md)]
Workflow themes define the look and feel of a workflow design surface. This includes background styles, foreground styles, fonts, and icons defined for the workflow.
A WorkflowTheme is a theme defined for a specific workflow. The <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.AmbientTheme> class can be used for default properties if a specific workflow theme is not desired.

Gets the associated with the .
Docs.value: An that describes default values for the look and feel of the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.AmbientTheme> describes the look and feel of a workflow design surface. This includes background styles, foreground styles, fonts, and icons defined for the workflow design surface.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to access the `AmbientTheme` property. This example is from the Tracking Profile Designer SDK sample. [!INCLUDE[crdefault](~/add/includes/crdefault-md.md)][Tracking Profile Designer Sample](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/a280199c-3000-4148-ac63-cb5aaeac07c8).
[!code-cs[Wf_samples#124](~/add/codesnippet/CSharp/wf_snippets/snippets1.cs#124)] [!code-vb[Wf_samples#124](~/add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/wf_snippets/snippets1.vb#124)]

Docs.summary: Creates a duplicate theme.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use `Clone` to create a duplicate theme with property settings that match the cloning theme.

Docs.summary: Gets the directory part of the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowTheme.FilePath%2A>.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use ContainingFileDirectory to get the directory part of the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowTheme.FilePath%2A>.

Docs.param: The of the standard theme to create.
Docs.summary: Creates a standard theme.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use CreateStandardTheme to create a new theme available anyone who uses the workflow designer.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the current theme.
Docs.value: A that is used for display settings.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use CurrentTheme to make changes to the theme used to display the workflow.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the CurrentTheme property to access the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.AmbientTheme> associated with a workflow.
This code example is part of the Workflow Monitor SDK Sample from the DesignerGlyphProvider.cs file. [!INCLUDE[crdefault](~/add/includes/crdefault-md.md)][Workflow Monitor](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/4f70c1c5-f82d-4d5f-8b7d-943b9f99f8e2).
[!code-cs[WF_Samples#133](~/add/codesnippet/CSharp/wf_snippets/snippets1.cs#133)] [!code-vb[WF_Samples#133](~/add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/wf_snippets/snippets1.vb#133)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the description of the theme.
Docs.exception: The property value cannot be set because the workflow theme is read-only.

Docs.summary: Gets a list of designer themes associated with the workflow.
Docs.value: A list of designer themes associated with the workflow.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use DesignerThemes to retrieve a list of designer themes that are associated with the workflow.

MemberSignature.Value: public static bool EnableChangeNotification { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to enable change notification.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Enabling change notification causes the theme changed events to occur when changes to the theme are made.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the file path for the theme.
Docs.value: The file path for the theme.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The FilePath represents the path to the file that stores the theme settings.

Docs.exception: The property value cannot be set because the workflow theme is read-only.

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, allows an object to clean up any resources deterministically.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method cleans up resources by calling <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowTheme.System%23IDisposable%23Dispose%2A>(`false`). Override <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowTheme.System%23IDisposable%23Dispose%2A> to customize the cleanup.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name of the theme.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the name to uniquely identify the theme among other themes.

Docs.exception: The property value cannot be set because the workflow theme is read-only.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the workflow theme is read-only.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example shows how to set and un-set the `ReadOnly` property for the purposes of setting the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowTheme.AmbientTheme%2A> property. This example is from the Tracking Profile Designer SDK sample. remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the registry key to provide a unique place in the Windows registry to save theme information.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the version information to indicate successive improvements to a named theme.
